III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Communication
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4124
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a written policy regarding
Description communication that ensures that a child is able to communicate
with family and friends in a manner appropriate to the child’s
1

functioning and consistent with the child’s treatment plan and
security level.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member hung up the phone on this youth while they were
in the middle of a phone conversation.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 05/14/2024 by phone.
Complainant stated Youth A told her that Staff Person 1
“snatched” the phone away from her.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/17/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence. Youth A stated Staff Person 1 told her to finish up her
phone call to allow another youth to make a phone call. Youth A
stated Staff Person 1 “snatched” the phone out of her hand as she
was saying goodbye. Youth A stated this incident happened
outside in the pavilion and there were no witnesses.
Staff Person 1 was interviewed on 05/17/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence. Staff Person 1 stated he asked Youth A to wrap up
her phone call when she had two minutes left on her 15-minute
phone call. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A held the phone out and
he took the phone from Youth A’s hand when she finished the call.
Staff Person 1 denied snatching the phone from Youth A.
Video
5/10/2024 at 1:03 PM video tape shows Staff Person 1 sitting in a
chair under the pavilion. Youth A stands to the left of Staff Person
1 and talks on the phone using the speaker function. Staff Person
1 holds out his hand in gesture to get the phone back. Youth A
continues to talk on the phone. Youth A turns her hand over with
the phone in her hand and extends her arm towards Staff Person
1. Staff Person 1 takes the phone from Youth A. Youth A walks
away. Staff Person 1 follows Youth A.
Tour
The pavilion is located on Mott Children’s Residence campus next
to the school. The pavilion covers a cement area where youths
can play basketball.
2

Analysis The agency is found in compliance with their communication
policy and procedure. Youth A was permitted to make and
complete her phone call without Staff Person 1 snatching the
phone away from her.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member is rude towards a youth and picks on her all day.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 05/14/2024 by phone.
Complainant stated Youth A told her that Staff Person 1 is rude to
her and called her “crazy”. Complainant did not have additional
information.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/17/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence. Youth A stated she told Staff Person 1 that he should
not have snatched the phone from her. Youth A stated Staff
Person 1 said, “I don’t need to snatch anything from a little ass.
Stop talking to me.” Youth A stated she replied, “You don’t need to
cuss like a sailor if you are a grown independent man. You need
to start controlling your anger and act like a grown man.” Youth A
stated the incident ended without further verbal exchange. Youth
A stated this incident happened outside under the pavilion and
there are no witnesses. Youth A denied any other incident of
name calling or derogatory comments made by Staff Person 1 or
staff at Mott Children’s Residence.
3

Staff Person 1 was interviewed on 05/17/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence. Staff Person 1 denied having a verbal exchange with
Youth A after her phone call.
Video
5/10/2024 at 1:03 PM Video does not record sound. Youth A and
Staff Person 1 do not appear to have a verbal exchange after Staff
Person 1 takes the phone from Youth A’s extended hand.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance of speaking to Youth A with
appropriate language. Staff Person 1’s interview and the video do
not support a verbal exchange occurred between Youth A and
Staff Person 1 after Youth A completed her phone call.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Personal hygiene
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4148
Section (1) An institution shall assure that each resident maintains or
Description receives personal care, hygiene, and grooming appropriate to the
resident’s age, sex, race, cultural background, and health needs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility requires a towel be used for three days before washing
it.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 05/14/2024 by phone.
Complainant stated Youth A was used to using one fresh
washcloth for her face and one fresh washcloth for body each time
she bathes.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/17/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence. Youth A stated she asked for fresh washcloths and
towels and Staff Person 1 told her to use the same ones for three
days before getting clean ones. Youth A stated Staff Person 1 told
her she was “crazy” or “acting crazy” when she explained to Staff
Person 1 that it is not hygienic to use the same washcloth or towel
twice. Youth A stated Mott Children’s Residence staff on third shift
washes her clothes and if they are unable to wash them then she
may wash her own clothes with supervision. Youth A stated staff
4

know to wash her whites, colors and darks separately and
separately from other youth’s clothes. Youth A stated Supervisor 1
helped her teach midnight staff how to wash her belongings and
helped her create a laundry schedule for midnight staff to follow.
Youth A stated she currently has enough washcloths and towels
to not use a washcloth or towel twice.
Staff Person 1 was interviewed on 05/17/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence. Staff Person 1 recalled Youth A being upset that her
clothes were washed incorrectly by midnight shift. Staff Person 1
stated he never washed Youth A’s towels or clothes because he is
not a midnight shift staff. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A became
more upset when he told her that her washcloth and towel can be
used more than once before laundering. Staff Person 1 denied
telling Youth A she was “crazy”, but admitted to saying Youth A
was “acting crazy” about not being able to use a towel more than
once. Staff Person 1 stated he met with Supervisor 1 and
understands not to engage in power struggles.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 05/17/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was upset that her
laundry was not done to her specifications. Supervisor 1 stated
she developed a laundry plan with Youth A on 05/04/2024 to
ensure Youth A’s whites, colors and darks are washed in separate
loads and not mixed with another youth’s laundry. The plan
specifies midnight shift staff to wash Youth A’s laundry and if
Youth A's laundry is not done then Youth A may do her own
laundry during waking hours under the supervision of staff.
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was also upset with a verbal
exchange she had with Staff Person 1 over towels being used
more than once. Supervisor 1 stated she met with Staff person 1
and discussed not engaging in power struggles and explained that
the agency is able to accommodate Youth A with additional
towels. Supervisor 1 stated she also discussed with Staff Person 1
other word choices besides “acting crazy” are to be used when
working with a youth. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was provided
extra towels to allow her to have fresh towels each time she
bathes.
Documentation
Supervisor 1 wrote an incident report dated 05/04/2024 that
coincides with her interview.
Staff Person 1 was hired on 03/15/2024. Staff Person 1 completed
new hire orientation training and on the job shadowing.
5

Analysis The agency is found in compliance of providing the necessary
towels for Youth A to bathe regularly.
CONSULTATION
Mott Children Residence did on the job coaching with Staff Person
1, who is a new employee. This is great practice and should
continue with Staff Person 1 and other staff as needed.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
